intro: Gaertnera hongkongensis, commonly known as Hong Kong hawthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. Gaertnera hongkongensis typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
